recipes.title: Cocktail Friday: Rosemary Martini + Frozen Grapes

winePairing.pairingText: Mexican on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Sparkling rosé. Acidic white wines like riesling or low-tannin reds like pinot noir can work well with Mexican dishes. Sparkling rosé is a safe pairing too. The The Donum Estate Russian River Valley Pinot Noir with a 4.9 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 67 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: The Donum Estate Russian River Valley Pinot Noir
productMatches.description: This Pinot Noir displays abundant and intense aromas of ripe black fruits, including cherry, plum and raspberry, in a complex and concentrated nose. Smooth and richly textured, the wine offers great depth of black cherry, berry and cola flavors with notes of mineral and spice on a bright and long-lasting finish.

recipes.instructions: Begin by making your frozen grape garnish. You'll want to do this at least half an hour in advance to the grapes are nice and cold when you put them in your cocktail. I like to make a lot of these and stick them in a freezer bag to I can pull them out any time I need them. All you need to do is this: thread 3 grapes onto a toothpick and place in a freezer bag in the freezer. They are great for snacking, too!Shake just until the liquid is chilled, about 20-30 seconds. Strain into two chilled cocktail glasses, garnish with your rosemary sprigs and frozen grapes. Serve.

All you need to do is this: thread 3 grapes onto a toothpick and place in a freezer bag in the freezer. They are great for snacking, too!Shake just until the liquid is chilled, about 20-30 seconds. Strain into two chilled cocktail glasses, garnish with your rosemary sprigs and frozen grapes.
